messages.content: What is the purpose of the youtube-dl-comfyui extension?
The youtube-dl-comfyui extension is used for downloading videos and audio from YouTube and other sites in ComfyUI.
What information should be provided when reporting an issue with youtube-dl-comfyui?

When reporting an issue, you should provide the youtube-dl-comfyui version, Python version, operating system, a description of what you were trying to do, what happened, what went wrong, and what you expected to happen.
What should be included in the 'What I Did' section when reporting an issue with youtube-dl-comfyui?
In the 'What I Did' section, you should paste the command(s) you ran and the output. If there was a crash, you should include the traceback.
Is the Python version required when reporting an issue with youtube-dl-comfyui?
Yes, the Python version is one of the details that should be provided when reporting an issue.
Should you include what you expected to happen when reporting an issue with youtube-dl-comfyui?
Yes, you should describe what you expected to happen as part of the issue report.
Is it necessary to specify the operating system when reporting an issue with youtube-dl-comfyui?
Yes, specifying the operating system is important when reporting an issue with youtube-dl-comfyui.
What type of content can be downloaded using the youtube-dl-comfyui extension in ComfyUI?
Using the youtube-dl-comfyui extension, you can download videos and audio from YouTube and other sites.
What is the purpose of youtube-dl-comfyui?
The purpose of youtube-dl-comfyui is to download media from URLs using the ComfyUI custom node.
What are the supported platforms for youtube-dl-comfyui?
Based on the provided images, youtube-dl-comfyui supports downloading media from YouTube, QQ, and Vimeo.
How do you install youtube-dl-comfyui?

To install youtube-dl-comfyui, you need to: 1. Change directory to ComfyUI/custom_nodes, 2. Clone the repository using git, 3. Change directory into the cloned repository, and 4. Run pip install -r requirements.txt.
What happens when you provide a link to a playlist in youtube-dl-comfyui?
When you provide a link to a playlist in youtube-dl-comfyui, the videos from playlist_start to playlist_end will be downloaded and output in a batch.
Can you use yt-dlp CLI arguments for configuration in youtube-dl-comfyui?
Yes, you can use any of the yt-dlp CLI arguments for configuration in youtube-dl-comfyui.
How can you use a proxy with youtube-dl-comfyui?
To use a proxy with youtube-dl-comfyui, you can simply add the command --proxy "socks5://127.0.0.1:1080" to the yt_dlp_cli_args text box.
What are the requirements for youtube-dl-comfyui?
The requirement for youtube-dl-comfyui is yt-dlp.
